oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1957-12-14 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from December 14, 1957. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Ray Price (host/performer), guest performer Patsy Cline, and regular performers Rod Brasfield (recently back from New York making a movie with Zsa Zsa Gabor), Tommy Jackson, the Jordanaires, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 950th broadcast, though in fact it is likely the 949th.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ray Price; Rod Brasfield; Patsy Cline; Tommy Jackson; Jordanaires
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Ray Price -- My Shoes Keep Walking Back To You (Ray Price) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Ray Price) -- Ray Price introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Ray Price) -- Ray Price introduces Patsy Cline -- Walkin' After Midnight (Patsy Cline) -- Prince Albert commercial (Rod Brasfield, Ray Price) -- Ray Price introduces Tommy Jackson -- [Unidentified fiddle tune] (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Ray Price talks -- In The Garden (Ray Price, Jordanaires)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Brasfield, Rod; Minnie Pearl; Atkins, Chet; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Jordanaires (Musical group); Jackson, Tommy; Price, Ray, 1926-2013; Cline, Patsy, 1932-1963
